intro: Scrophularia cymigera, commonly known as the clustered figwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are tubular and usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Scrophularia cymigera thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
